benchmark_details.name: GLGE (General Language Generation Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: GLGE is a new multi-task benchmark for evaluating the generalization capabilities of NLG models across eight language generation tasks, designed to encourage research on pretraining and transfer learning in natural language generation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate the development, evaluation, and comparison of new NLG models across diverse tasks and difficulty levels.

data.source: Combination of six existing popular NLG datasets and two new datasets selected from real-world scenarios.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are aggregated based on performance across all tasks.
methodology.interpretation: The scores represent the level of success in generating coherent and contextually relevant outputs for each task.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparative results with models such as MASS, BART, and ProphetNet on the GLGE benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Performance on different levels of task difficulty (Easy, Medium, Hard) is evaluated to determine model generalization capabilities.
